Package silverlib.music

Class Song

  • java.lang.Object
    • silverlib.music.Song
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Song
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a musical piece on the piano, with treble and bass tracks, loaded from a text file formatted according to https://silordoflight.github.io/silverlib/javaDoc/SongFormat.html
    Since:
    1.10
    Author:
    Jake Trimble
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Initializes a Song object using the string file path of the source file

      • play

        public void play​()
          throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException,
                 javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException,
                 java.lang.InterruptedException
        Plays the song through the devices current audio output, sleeps process until finished, then stops player
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - If Midi is currently unavailable
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - If the javax.midi.Sequence is corrupted
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the Thread is interrupted
        Since:
        1.10.4

                 throws java.io.IOException,

        Parameters:

        nm - The name of the Song
        Returns:
        The Song
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If load fails
